meanings.definition: To track again or retrace a path or route.
meanings.sent1: After getting lost, she had to start retracking her steps to find her way back home.
meanings.sent2: I will be retracking my journey to make sure I didn't miss any important landmarks.
meanings.sent3: The detective was retracking the suspect's movements, trying to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was retracking her life choices, trying to figure out where she went wrong.
meanings.sent5: The hiker was retracking the trail in his mind, trying to remember where he took the wrong turn.

meanings.definition: The act of revisiting or revising a previous decision or plan.
meanings.sent1: The retracking of the project's timeline led to a more efficient schedule.
meanings.sent2: His constant retracking of his decisions made it hard for others to follow his lead.
meanings.sent3: The retracking of the meeting agenda caused confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent4: Her retracking of the budget allocation resulted in significant cost savings.
meanings.sent5: The retracking of the company's goals helped them realign their priorities.
